data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3598098,"name":"Jugad S.","username":"jsingh","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c37758/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-20T23:49:44.041Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eHello \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eCD\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Chief Delphi\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e,\u003cbr\u003e\nAfter a long season of trying and testing methods of getting the robot to squeeze out a little bit of performance, I learned a lot. The main idea that I realize now is that in order to make good automations, a high performance, smooth robot, you need really good, consistent odometry. I’ve seen a lot of \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eCD\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Chief Delphi\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e posts about how great and easy the QuestNav is to use, but I haven’t found much documentation on how to set it up, and it’s still not a widely-used method, which makes me reluctant to lean towards that. We had LL3gs on the robot this year and we used them for odometry and alignment, which were good but not great. How do I make an odometry system that is consistent, extremely accurate, and not impossible to create (we have a very small programming subteam and relatively new people)? I know that this is a topic that a lot of people would love to learn and talk about so let’s get a discussion going.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":2,"updated_at":"2025-04-20T23:49:44.041Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":18,"reads":191,"readers_count":190,"score":143.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":499943,"topic_slug":"odometry-questnav-and-season-thoughts","display_username":"Jugad S.","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69335,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/odometry-questnav-and-season-thoughts/499943/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3598100,"name":"Jugad S.","username":"jsingh","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c37758/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-20T23:50:48.164Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eFor context, we tried out using OTF path gen for alignment, which didn’t really work out because the odometry was always just a bit off -
